author: rhysstoic
title: Plutus Pioneers Upgraded
description: The Plutus Pioneer Program is great, but is difficult to follow and lacks depth of exercises and grading

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal aims to extend the Plutus Pioneers Program (PPP) which is a course by IOG teaching Plutus. As a developer learning Haskell and Plutus for the past three months, I've been following PPP in the current iteration and have first hand knowledge. The proposer points out the problem with PPP - it is difficult to follow, lacks depth of exercises and grading. The PPP has little supporting documentation, not many exercises and doesn't explore the larger scope of tooling. I must agree with this assessment. The PPP can be a much more hands on learning experience: supporting the developer in all its Plutus related learning, guiding them through exercises and becoming a knowledge base.  

Extending the PPP is a very much in line with the goals of the challenge. This will fill in gaps in the learning stage for developers, making learning Plutus and hence building on Cardano easier.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers are a team of three bringing in expertise in Stake Pools, Software Development, Plutus Pioneers Program, Coaching and Online Courses. I think these backgrounds do apply to creating a good PPP extension course. In terms of technical skills to create videos, edit, and create a course on gitbook, I think the team can succeed without issue. 

One thing is not clear though: the level of expertise the team has in Haskell and Plutus. There are two developers on the team but only one is a Plutus Pioneer. Another team member with a non-developer background is also a Pioneer. The Pioneer developer has no linkedin or other information source available, so we don't know the extent of their expertise. The other developer does not list Haskell or Plutus as an expertise on their linkedin. It's not clear if the team does have a deep expertise in Haskell and Plutus. 

I think it would be difficult to implement some of the more advanced topics in the proposal without extensive experience. This is especially important, since the proposal sets 2 weeks for developing Plutus exercises and 2 weeks for scripting, drafting and recording all the modules for the course. This seems a blazing pace for such a comprehensive and complicated topic as Plutus. 

Even with these questions, I think the team will still be able to build most of this course in a reasonable amount of time. They have relevant experience and can get expert support if they need it.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal outlines some of the topics that will be covered by the course. When and how these topics will be covered will be decided in phase 1. The proposal covers 10 weeks with 6 phases. Planned phases are 2 weeks each with the exception of the last phase which covers course release and onboarding. There is little detail provided as to what each phase means beyond a general idea. There are no clear deliverables for each phase. 

But there are some information that will be useful for auditors. The phases do give a general sense of the project. After phase 1, the proposal should produce some plan for the structure of the course. What will be taught, What chapter will be taught first, etc. After phase 3, the proposers should have videos for all the course. These deliverables are not defined well but they do give a good idea of what to expect.

f6_assessments.q0: The main goal of this solution is to better assist developers to engage in the Cardano faster and more efficiently. And this is what the challenge is looking for, solutions that enhance developers' experience and encourage them to join Cardano. The proposal described clearly its solution, an on-demand course teaching Plutus with exercises, challenges, and more content related to all Plutus tools. By pointing out some drawbacks of the Plutus  Pioneer course, it is easy to see all of the improved features and functions of the proposed products. This is indicated clearer by providing an outline of some course material. All of the mentioned factors contribute to emphasizing the impact of this solution on developers that help them better understand Plutus and its tools to create more projects and better design contracts. All the benefits offered will bring more developers to Cardano. Another highlight here is that it determined what may hinder the process of delivering this project and how to overcome it.
f6_assessments.q1: The detail of how the project will be executed was well-written. It separated the process into 6 different small phases and described what should be done in each phase with a deadline for each task. So it is quite easy to follow this plan. The budget breakdown was listed but did not mention those costs would be used for how long or the measurable unit of them. A team operating this project was given, However, it should add the information about the background, the skills, and related experience along with a link to their profile. This will help build trust in the sponsor about how feasible this project is. Now, it is really hard to claim that this project is feasible to operate because it is unknown whether all people involved have enough expertise and experience to successfully build this course.
f6_assessments.q2: No KPIs or key metrics were given to measure the progress of this project. It is unclear to say that we can track the progress through the roadmap and timeline in the plan without any figures or criteria to evaluate whether the project is going on track or not. A good point here is that it provided a clear expected success with a specific figure. But overall, it is still difficult to track, trace and audit a project without KIPs

f6_assessments.q0: the clarification of the problem highlighted your solution. I believe this is a potential idea. There is no doubting the project's positive impact on Cardano. In this section, you also provide an overview of some of the course materials. I appreciate your solution. It is very likely to develop in the future. The risks have also been mentioned and hopefully they will be resolved soon. Your presentation is great.
f6_assessments.q1: your detailed and clear roadmap proves the feasibility of the project. I am extremely impressed with this. The stages and activities are laid out very logically. Detailed budgets have also been provided in the proposal. Three members of your team have excellent profiles. With their support, I believe in the success of this project.
f6_assessments.q2: 5000 Plutus developers at the end of the year is an impressive number. With a very wonderful roadmap mentioned earlier, I believe this project is completely auditable. What it brings to our Cardano ecosystem is also something that interests me and it's great that you mentioned it at the end of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Plutus is the Cardano blockchain's smart contract platform, and the proposer has taken a Plutus course. With their teaching experience, the proposers believe that a better structured course is required for more in-depth learning. The idea is great, the problem is clearly stated in this proposal, and the solution is thoroughly explained. It would be helpful if the proposer could break down how the $20 fee can be spent on each course. I just have one more question: how will this course differ from other courses? The proposer may include some of the new features that are only available in this course.  The proposer can point out in the course material section. This gives me and those who want to participate the course additional assurances.
f6_assessments.q1: With a budget of $24000, the team will need 10 weeks to prepare. To the team's audience, the team has a background in education, though there is no proof of this yet. In the first two weeks, the team built the course structure; I would appreciate it if the budget was also broken down in the roadmap. Aside from the goal of providing new developers with more in-depth training, the proposer should specify how long the course will be available. as well as the cost of keeping the course running. I believe the project will contribute a significant amount of knowledge and aid in the expansion of the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q2: How people in the course improve and use it to help work with Plutus is how the course succeeds. The proposer does not inform the readers about the various metrics that can be used to help auditing. The goal is to train 5000 Plutus developers by the end of the year, but there is not much information available. Perhaps the proposer could break down how they qualify to be Plutus developers after completing the course and testing their abilities Then declare the project's success and how the proposal can help increase the number of good Plutus developers in the future.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the challenge in the way that it is proposing to create a new educational tool that completes and expands on the existing Plutus Pioneers program to be able to attract more developers into the ecosystem via an educational program that is better prepared than the existing one.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan presented in the proposal seems realistic and achievable given the time line proposed and the detail included in it, the team that is in charge of executing the project seems to be fully equiped with the necessary knowledge and experience to develop this project successfully.
Budget wise, there is a clear division of what the requested funds are going to be used for specifically which is useful for the public to know where the funds will be going and makes the project more credible given the team has very clear what they need to spend the money on and what are the true components of their solution.
Overall very well put proposal that seems straightforward to implement with some support from Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q2: As the assessment states in their measures of success their plan is to to help onboard developers and foster a strong developer ecosystem which is crucial for the growth of Cardano and the development of new projects within the ecosystem, and how the team plans to do it is put very clearly in the proposal with more than enough information provided to understand what the proposers want to achieve and how they plan to achieve it (and by when). Concise but detailed information will allow easy auditability of the project and will guide the team to successfully implement this training course which can hopefully bring some new talent into Cardano.

solution: Create a more in-depth and on demand Plutus Smart Contract Course to help on board more developers faster and more efficiently
experience: Plutus Pioneer, Coach / Instructor & Course Creator, SPO, Marketing
